Description: Amulet, in the form of a flat red pouch of Morocco leather having two flaps; at the corners are pieces of snake skin.
Curator's comments: The slip calls this a "Common amulet". Af.4045 to 4056 are all registered as possibly from Egypt or Turkey. They all seem to have been bought by Henry Christy himself (see As.4050) but whether in Turkey or Egypt is not clear. Some have been put in the Asian collection. The ones remaining in the African collection (with Af prefixes) have been described on the database as Egypt?.
